definition: lifetime/generation/group of people/class/classifier for generations/(literary) classifier for people

sentences.english: It’s St Peter’s, whom your fathers chased away.
sentences.chinese: 這城池是聖彼得的，你們的父輩將他從這裏趕走。

sentences.english: That means we will have the same father who together put up a blue sky.
sentences.chinese: 那意味着我們將要同父輩們一起，共同撐起一片藍天。

sentences.english: My father is in my eyes don't understand, make a great river north and south in.
sentences.chinese: 我的父輩就在我的不懂的眼光中，闖蕩在大江南北。

sentences.english: So the life we are riving now is more civilized than that of our fore-fathers.
sentences.chinese: 所以我們現在的生活要比父輩們從前的生活更文明。

sentences.english: They are more ambitious and less content than their elders were.
sentences.chinese: 他們要比他們的父輩更有抱負，卻更少滿足感。

sentences.english: Situations where the use and wont of their fathers no longer meet their necessities" J. A."
sentences.chinese: “他們父輩的習慣性作法無法解決他們的困難情況”。

sentences.english: He also has some recommendations for parents about video games.
sentences.chinese: 他也有一些父輩關於電子遊戲的建議。

sentences.english: To be as good as our fathers and mothers , we must be better.
sentences.chinese: 我們要像父輩一樣優秀，就必須青出於藍勝於藍。

sentences.english: But we do this because our parents' generation expected it.
sentences.chinese: 而父輩們則希望我們按老規矩辦。

sentences.english: Like many other writers, Fang Fang has expressed humble and incompetent images of fathers.
sentences.chinese: 和許多作家一樣方方抒寫了卑瑣無能的父輩形象。

definition: of the same generation/person of the same generation/peer
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
elder brother/term of respect for a man of about the same age
to leave one's homeplace (to find work, flee disaster etc)
adoption (e.g. of a nephew as a son)/to inherit
to seek one's livelihood/to work to support oneself/to earn a living
passed on from ancestors/handed down from generation to generation
homeless and miserable (idiom); to wander about in a desperate plight/to drift
